channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On pro-cdh descent on derived schemes
item.description: arXiv:2407.04378v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We prove a `pro-cdh descent' result for suitably connective localizing invariants and the cotangent complex on arbitrary qcqs derived schemes. As an application, we deduce a generalised Weibel vanishing for negative $K$-groups of non-Noetherian schemes.
item.dc:creator: Shane Kelly, Shuji Saito, Georg Tamme

item.title: Gorenstein objects in the n-Trivial extensions of abelian categories
item.description: arXiv:2005.09038v3 Announce Type: replace Abstract: Given an abelian category, we introduce a categorical concept of (strongly) Gorenstein projective (resp., injective) objects, by defining a new special class of objects. Then we study the transfer of these properties when passing to an abelian category and its n-trivial extension category and also give a characterization of Gorenstein object over it. We give, at the end, applications of this study on the category of modules over an associative ring and triangular matrix rings.
item.dc:creator: Dirar Benkhadra

item.title: On the relative Gersten conjecture for Milnor K-theory in the smooth case
item.description: arXiv:2010.02622v4 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We show that the Gersten complex for the (improved) Milnor K-sheaf on a smooth scheme over an excellent discrete valuation ring is exact except at the first place and that exactness at the first place may be checked at the discrete valuation ring associated to the the generic point of the special fiber. This complements results of Gillet and Levine for K-theory, Geisser for motivic cohomology and Schmidt and Strunk and the author for \'etale cohomology.
item.dc:creator: Morten L\"uders
